Emerging growth company &#x2610; &#160; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the Registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; Item 5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders. &#160; The 2023 Annual Meeting of Shareholders (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;) of Apple Inc. (&#8220;Apple&#8221;) was held on March 10, 2023. At the Annual Meeting, Apple&#8217;s shareholders voted on the following nine proposals and cast their votes as described below. &#160; 1. The individuals listed below were elected at the Annual Meeting to serve as directors of Apple until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified: &#160; For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote James Bell 9,465,679,895 66,756,373 27,788,697 3,199,709,505 Tim Cook 9,384,013,653 154,755,524 21,455,788 3,199,709,505 Al Gore 8,717,788,168 754,211,726 88,225,071 3,199,709,505 Alex Gorsky 9,345,154,817 185,107,464 29,962,684 3,199,709,505 Andrea Jung 8,886,421,911 638,629,879 35,173,175 3,199,709,505 Art Levinson 8,982,747,341 549,024,146 28,453,478 3,199,709,505 Monica Lozano 9,470,339,256 61,625,010 28,260,699 3,199,709,505 Ron Sugar 8,935,381,470 595,179,126 29,664,369 3,199,709,505 Sue Wagner 9,172,832,824 360,662,024 26,730,117 3,199,709,505 2. A management proposal to ratify the appointment of Ernst &amp; Young LLP as Apple&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2023 was approved. &#160; For Against Abstained 12,569,833,138 154,378,601 35,722,731 3. An advisory resolution to approve executive compensation was approved. &#160; For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 8,450,622,819 1,037,238,044 72,364,102 3,199,709,505 4. A majority of shareholders voted for 1 Year on an advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation. 1 Year 2 Years 3 Years Abstained 9,373,118,972 30,603,953 122,956,354 33,545,686 Based on these results, and consistent with the recommendation of Apple&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Board&#8221;), the Board has determined that Apple will hold an advisory vote on executive compensation every year. 5. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Civil Rights and Non-Discrimination Audit Proposal&#8221; was not approved. &#160; For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 132,449,397 9,322,879,571 104,895,997 3,199,709,505 6. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Communist China Audit&#8221; was not approved. For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 413,232,649 9,001,346,586 145,645,730 3,199,709,505 7. A shareholder proposal on Board policy for communication with shareholder proponents was not approved. For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 611,602,995 8,865,309,276 83,312,694 3,199,709,505 8. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Racial and Gender Pay Gaps&#8221; was not approved. For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 3,186,369,941 6,227,476,677 146,378,347 3,199,709,505 9. A shareholder proposal entitled &#8220;Shareholder Proxy Access Amendments&#8221; was not approved. For Against Abstained Broker Non-Vote 2,934,328,973 6,535,240,600 90,655,392 3,199,709,505 SIGNATURE &#160; Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the Registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized.
